comment._content: There seems to be a date in reverse up the left hand edge, 5/26/10

comment.author: 40384762@N08
comment._content: Likely related to: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3314494582/ The Free Thought Magazine, volume 17, in 1899 (published/edited by H. L. Green) describes: "Rhoda J. Glover, of Baldwins, Long Island, NY, has been a subscriber to this Magazine from the first number. She is an intelligent Freethinker, and was among the first in her State to work for female suffrage. It is now wonder the voters of Baldwins have elected her a member of the Board of Education, where she is doing much good in the cause of education." [from University of Michigan Library collection, via Google Books]

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: See article in The Washington herald., May 25, 1913, Image 1, column 2, "ROSALIE JONES & CO. OFF ANOTHER HIKE"
